Comparez: tôe. Inaccompli: tôogda. nominal: tôogre. Verbe. 1° pouvoir; can do. A makame n pa tôog yù. Il a essayé mais n'a pas pu faire. He tried but he couldn't do it. 2° maîtriser, vaincre, avoir le dessus, battre à un jeu; overpower, overcome, defeat, win in a game. Tôn'd yôka maoor t' tôog maam n luib. Nous avons lutté et il m'a vaincu en me terrassant. We wrestled together and he won as he threw me to the ground. 3° avoir lieu, se produire; occur, take place. Yikaadâa kâ tôog ye. Le mariage n'a pas eu lieu. The wedding did not take place.

Inaccompli: tôogda. nominal: tôogre. Plural: tô, toôse. Verbe. déchirer, tear: A gâda fuugã n tôog zîis à yiblu. Il a pris le tissu et l’a déchiré en deux parties. He took the cloth and tore it in two parts.
Plural: tôog-m~mense. Nom. maîtrise de soi; self-control.

This work is painful. 3° Verbe. cher, expensive. Neodâ wâ yaa toog wsgo. Les chaussures coûtent trop cher. The shoes are too expensive.

Plural: toodo. Nom. souffrance, peine, douleur, dureté, malheur; suffering, pain, distress, ache, hurt, hardship, hardness, woe. A yâa toog à bâaga wakato. Il a connu la souffrance durant sa maladie. He had a lot of suffering while he was ill. Catégorie: Maladie.
synonyme: toore. Nom. préoccupation, soucis; preoccupation, sorrow, anxiety, concern, care. A toog ka be ye! Il n'est pas préoccupé de cela! He is not concerned about that!
